at the gate

it seems

doesn't drown him out...
crow

bang open


1795

at the gate
how many thousands of bushels
of far mist?


1795

it's tepid...

all the swallows' nests

a holiday

voices of pilgrims

sick of it

this way, that way...

1803

over one wall
the sea wind blows...
winter moon


1803

the winter moon
hanging over...
back window


1803

the winter moon
on my lap...
mountain home


1803

cedars are tall
in my hometown...
first winter rain


1803

even the warlord's horse
wears his crest


1803

a second winter rainfall...
mountain home


1803

smells burnt


1803

where smoke rises...

1803

1803

the winter rain

1803

it's off, it's on

1803

toward his home village


1803

a rice field crane
stands tall


1803

his parents' gate


1803

1803

1803

three meals a day
this trip, too much!

1803

"The wind
is cold! cold! cold!"
ceramic lamp


1803

1803

1803

1803

1803

hearing of first snow
a dreadful thing...
old man

softly, softly clings...

1803

1803

blazes still more...

1803

strange--
the moon shining
while sleet falls


1803

open for business...

1803

falling sleet

1803

even my bamboo plant

a fence...

1803

all greens...

rice cake tub

barely in sight...

I thought by now this journey
would've ended


1804

three drops...

as last year

1804

autumn evening--
from elsewhere another horse
neighs in reply


1804

even the pestle
becomes part of the scene...
a long night


1804

the horse neighs...
a long night

farewell to autumn...
bright moon


1804

cawing in the tree
are you a widow, crow?
Milky Way above

'til the moon breaks through...
my house


1804

on a clear, rainless night

autumn sky

he's just like me

a beggar looking

is louder

come from the Mountain
of Swords?


1804

on my pilgrimage

cloth-pounders


1805

rising smoke
towering pine, then...
cloth-pounding


1805

the owl comes
to lend a hand...
cloth-pounding


1805

remote province--
even in the haunted field
pounding cloth


1805

I leave my chrysanthemum
for the evening...
fresh-brewed sake


1805

high tide--
splish-splash
goes the buck


1805

the young buck
tries to hide
in bush clover


1805

do you think you're hiding
in that bush clover?
face of a deer


1805

this mountain rain
and the deer's tears
must be mingling


1805

only after the woodpecker
flies...
back in my hut


1805

the woodpecker returns
to the pine...
now I'm old


1805

the woodpecker works
one spot...
all through sunset


1805

the woodpecker
pecks it to death...
the post


1805

honking geese--
I picture skies
over inns


1805

just today and tomorrow
left of autumn!
rice field geese


1805

an insect chirps--
yesterday it wasn't there
hole in the wall


1805

cricket--
you too have adapted to life
in Edo


1805

katydid--
"katy-katy!" not dead
yet


1805

not a thicket
for a katydid's singing
in sight


1805

even in the barn's shade
if there's grass
there's autumn blooms


1805

even in the sky
Buddha dwells...
wildflowers


1805

blocking the gate--
morning-glories
and a slob


1805

into morning-glories
with one shoulder bare...
holy man


1805

farmhouse


1805

lost
in the morning-glories
little house


1805

on the morning-glories...
sitting still


1805

in morning-glories
a chill chilling
my spine


1805

in the morning-glories
warming up...
the cold


1805

morning-glories
even in sewer mud
a morning scene


1805

wet with morning dew...
a tough character


1805

the morning-glories are the first
to stir


1805

on the busy gate, too
morning-glories
bloom


1805

my house's pitiful
morning-glories, too
greet the dawn


1805

tumbling head over heels...
autumn colors


1805

mountain field--
the mouse's hole too
under red leaves


1805

lushly blooming again
roses of Sharon


1805

they crowd to bloom
facing the sea...
roses of Sharon


1805

four or five...
mosquitoes whine


1805

chills the sake...
roses of Sharon


1805

have passed their season...
mosquitoes whine


1805

on peaks, in valleys
all the way to Takaya


1805

even the willow
is lonely...
rose of Sharon


1805

night after night
a good wind blows...
roses of Sharon


1805

the moon emerges
'round a curve...
the gourd


1805

all the mountains
are looking old...
gourds


1805

with the emptiness
of bare trees...
this year ends


1805

for me and the pine
this damned year, too
ends


1805

its mouth open
waiting for spring?
paper dog


1805

waiting for spring
sparrows also make a home
in the bamboo


1805

year's end--
the bell of my death place
tolls too


1805

year's end--
when will my turn come
temple bell?


1805

bamboo thicket--
on the year's last day, too
evening rain


1805

first snowfall--
the crows of Kasai
happily caw


1805

just existing
I exist...
snow flitting down


1805

night snow--
in a hush people
passing


1805

hurry along!
in nighttime hail
on wooden clogs


1805

expecting a night
of spring...
night frost


1805

the pine tree's head too
swept for soot

1805

the nettle tree


1805

the usual evening rain...

the young pine needs

bell of old age...

plain, light-blue

the pony's face


1806

another year
just taking up space...
thatched hut

no plum blossoms yet

is all decked out...
the emperor's spring

1806

1806

rice field of Nara

1807

from the tub in the reeds
a croaking
frog


1807

next to my shadow
that
of a frog


1807

frogs croaking
the nights becoming
shorter


1807

in leafy shade
an old man's voice...
a frog!


1807

in leafy shade
gazing at the camellia...
croaking frog


1807

"Come see
the crappy house at night!"
croak the frogs


1807

an evening frog
in rainy weeds sings
of old age


1807

at my gate
the hoarse frog
keeps singing


1807

a butterfly on the wet
horse's leg
now and then, sleeps


1807

thicket bees
in the next life don't
be like me


1807

cogon grass--
the horse gazes
at plum blossoms


1807

the pony's
favorite neck-scratcher...
blooming plum


1807

at the thicket's edge
blooming on the sly...
plum trees


1807

with his umbrella...
blossom shade


1807

like the sky
over Katsushika...
clouds of blossoms


1807

cherry blossoms--
I've been living in Edo
for this day!


1807

rain of cherry blossoms--
this year, too
I've sinned


1807

cherry blossom shade--
"That was good thunder!"
he says


1807

cherry blossom clouds--
leaving Edo
tomorrow


1807

blossoming mountain--
even men who've knocked over Buddha
are here


1807

for the poor
there's not a spring
without blossoms!


1807

even in falling rain
satisfied faces...
blossom shade


1807

barks his distrust...
cherry blossoms!


1807

all stop...
cherry blossoms


1807

cherry blossom guard--
not much
of a Buddhist


1807

simply trust,
simply trust!
cherry blossoms in bloom


1807

the farm field too
is worth a look...
cherry blossoms


1807

in yellow roses
a great courtier's
thin kimono


1807

the village child
clutching the willow
sound asleep


1807

planting grass--
the nights are growing
shorter


1807

short summer night--
this morning on my pillow
dewdrops


1807

the crow scorns
my thatched house


1807

they watch from two houses
wildflowers


1807

looking again
looking again...
someone else's green field


1807

the sky colors
of dawn have changed
to summer clothes


1807

every time I put on
the summer kimono...
feel old


1807

such a moon!
yet he's under his fan
asleep


1807

the rivers have
an ancient darkness...
cuckoo


1807

cuckoo--
since you're in Kyoto
look at that moon!


1807

this year again, nothing
but weeds


1807

the cuckoo's becoming
a regular...
moonlit night


1807

making the nightingale
reach old age...
my thatched hut


1807

comes to sleep...
it too is old


1807

is my wrinkled hand
bad for walking?
first firefly


1807

while I'm gone
you and the nightingale are in charge
my snail


1807

fresh green leaves
blowing, blowing...
where I lie


1807

Echigo mountains--
a chill runs up
my spine


1807

my spine...
Echigo mountains


1807

my spine feels
the mottled mountain


1807

autumn evening--
this is nothing like
my home village

the cicadas sing

then clouds


1807

the beautiful voice

bell for the ancestors

mountain deer


1807

the hoe's a curse
I'm thinking tonight...

red dragonfly

autumn leaves

autumn leaves

how long will that turtle

for this homeless body
of mine, spring's
first day

on Naniwa Bay


1809

accusing the pine
of foolishness...
evening mist


1809

to my window
he comes as usual...
thin mist


1809

the evening bath
slish-slosh...
mist


1809

it's my umbrella-hat
don't run, geese!
first mist


1809

in heat shimmers
the vines people loathe...
beautiful


1809

heat shimmers--
yesterday it wasn't there
tea-and-dumpling shop


1809

snow melting--
for sparrows at the gate
good as a harvest moon!


1809

snow melting--
at the gate the sparrows'
New Year's bash!


1809

"I'm the first
of the migrating servants!"
a crow


1809

umbrella-hat and skirt
in the evening...
threshing tea leaves


1809

sunset...
Mount Tsukuba


1809

at dawn
the homeless cat, too
cries for love


1809

the lover cat
dandied up like Genji
at the fence


1809

settling into
the penny toss hole...
baby sparrow


1809

ten or twelve yards...
mother sparrow


1809

baby sparrow
inside a person's fist
its first cry


1809

peek out the nest...
sparrows

hushes to listen...

with its tail...
a pheasant


1809

seeing off

little pines


1809

an auspicious
twenty fifth day...
the geese depart


1809

traveling geese
my lake is crossed
in no time


1809

a butterfly flits
as if wanting nothing
in this world


1809

butterflies flitting--
pretty little bamboo shoots
shooting up


1809

nothing else blooming
but rape...
my hut


1809

behind it, in the light
wildflowers


1809

plum blossom scent--
I tell you spring
is a night thing


1809

the plum tree
where the stray cat carouses
in bloom


1809

even in summer
plum trees bloom

the edict board furnished
with sacred sake


1809

cherry blossoms flitting
down

bad Buddhists

the corrupt world

in all Musashi Plain
just one...
cuckoo


1810

useless me
useless weeds...
the cuckoo's opinion


1810

he's hated
by the young folk...
the dear cuckoo


1810

I've waited long
for thee
O cuckoo!


1810

come what may
praise Buddha!
mountain cuckoo


1810

cheered on
by a reed thrush
the incompetent thief


1810

a flower big
as an umbrella-hat...
flitting firefly


1810

an arm for a pillow--
though there's nagging
a firefly guest


1810

so quickly they join
the human goblins...
fireflies


1810

the owl
seems to be hooting
for fireflies


1810

shunning
the mountain hermit...
flitting fireflies


1810

though a poor-soiled
province...
such fireflies!


1810

in old age
mosquito-burning
the only great feat


1810

the bell clangs
"Come to mosquito country!
Come! Come!"


1810

a five foot tall
chrysanthemum


1810

deep in his sleeve
singing, a cicada


1810

look! next to me
a snail


1810

just as you are
become Buddha!
snail

the potted bamboo
rustles, rustles...
bonito!


1810

mountain cuckoo!
summer's first bonito

the day flower
blooms


1810

just being alive
I
and the poppy


1810

a vast wheat field
dotted with blooming
peonies

lotus blossom horseflies
feed


1810

1810

1810

from today on
hear my "Praise Buddha!"
lilies

evening

autumn evening--
wind in the window's little hole
plays flute


1811

the hole in the paper door
blows flute


1811

from the gate in the long night...
all four directions


1811

trailing the pickled radish
vendor


1811

which of you owns
that red moon
children?


1811

granny walks along
drinking sake...
a moonlit night

from my gate then up
Shinano Mountain

Sumida River

the face of the man

autumn wind

nice and hot

after their fleas...
autumn gale


1811

the sparrow licks it
clean


1811

gazing down, it seems
at dewdrops


1811

splashing struts
the crow


1811

washing arms and legs

hedgerow

1811

at my hut
the stray deer

no rice

who gave you wildflowers

1812

evening--
in a big sake cup
moon and a flea


1812

cicadas chirring
the red leaf flutters
down


1812

"first cicada!"
he says
while it pisses


1812

toward the lake...
cicada singing


1812

the dog turns
in the cicada's direction...
mouth agape


1812

the morning-glories
brightly bloom...
and bonito!


1812

a third day
for citizens of Edo...
summer's first bonito


1812

Sir Whiskers
has first crack
at summer's first bonito


1812

Musashi Plain--
Mount Fuji and bonito
on everyone's mind


1812

big tide--
the day flower clings
to the sand


1812

the day flower
splish-splash in the tide
blooms anyway


1812

blowing her snot
on the moonflower...
a young girl


1812

on the moonflower...
granny


1812

the moonflowers
get a drenching...
from my spoon


1812

a big field
by a little village...
poppies


1812

words
are a waste of time...
poppies


1812

the naked child crawls--
the blooming
poppies


1812

like a poppy
how it sways...
front tooth


1812

looks like it's built
on lotus leaves...
the hut


1812

devilishly long...
lotus blossoms


1812

holy Jizo
in the blooming pinks...
dead center


1812

a blooming pink--
the big bee
stings it!

wipe their feet...
on the irises

the young buck's antler...
lilies


1812

in the lilies


1812

a fawn's spots
in the lilies


1812

one by one in a row...
swallows


1812

teahouse!"


1812

the duckweed too
may have prayed...
blooming in the west


1812

but in the hut of reeds
"fish autumn"


1812

the rice paddy geese
with hoarse voices


1812

home village--
even on a thin post
moss has bloomed


1812

the thicket's bamboo
like all young folk
raising a ruckus


1812

depending on
the young bamboo...
little house


1812

summer's young bamboo--
joyful!
joyful!


1812

smelling the melon
shading his eyes to gaze...
a weasel


1812

I smell melons--
where might they be
katydid?


1812

big as her head...
baby

eggplant


1812

1812

a horror!


1812

of thick summer grass
works fine

nettle tree

a long night

it blows

slick with dew...
Chikuma River


1812

dewdrops are tumbling
look! there!


1812

even my thatched hut
made-up with dew

Kogane Field


1812

big pearls, little pearls
of dew

big and little

drip-drip, this world
is good!

break out into song

1812

it's become a night

1812

those wild geese

1812

about me


1812

you are Japanese geese...
rest easy

to dead silence...
rice field geese


1812

where to sleep

the cold!

cats making love

1813

the heat


1813

oh cool cool
evening!
the month's last day


1813

it's a down, down
downtrodden land...
but cool!


1813

is shut out too...
thatched hut


1813

what cool air--
snow and ice
two cents apiece

me and flame-drawn

the evening mountain

cool air--
a moonlit night fit

1813

lying spread-eagle
cool
lonely


1813

nothing at all
but a calm heart
and cool air


1813

two blades of grass
cheer for the cloudburst
I bring

my hut


1813

a summer rainstorm--
scratches
my itch


1813

a good omen--
in the west, deep red
billowing clouds


1813

of my outstretched toes...
billowing clouds

1813

pure water

1813

at my home
Shinano's moon

1813

a palm-sized rice field too
has greened


1813

evening's wooden drum


1813

the first to turn

1813

a green rice field


1813

for whose treasured child
this red fan?


1813

1813

1813

one drop of sweat
soon, another


1813

this day perhaps
even I'll do it...
new summer robe


1813

this evening's

sowing a fistful
of wheat...
sparrows at the gate


1813

"Are these the outskirts
of Kyoto?"
woman in a paper robe


1813

winter rain--
come! come!
my paper robe


1813

"From this tree on
am I in Nara?"
woman in a paper robe


1813

well suited--
down the slope they go
in paper robes


1813

row of houses--
the people in paper robes
hard to count


1813

playing with the god's
sacred monkeys...
paper robe


1813

like in old China
to Yoshino they go...
paper robes


1813

a face pokes out
the winter quilt...
"Hey, vegetable man!"


1813

fool cat--
yet he knows which futon
is his


1813

won't be long now
I'll hear the wild geese...
futon


1813

the man who left
slept in a ball...
futon


1813

tucking into my futon
just like Dharma
I sit


1813

tucking into my futon
tomorrow's straw sandals
by the pillow


1813

my eyes glaring, glaring--
just like Dharma
in my futon


1813

waking up
to a row of dolls...
my futon


1813

my last resort--
I borrow the cat's
futon


1813

at my dwelling
the lumped-together snow...
foothills


1813

dawn--
with snow I make
Lord Buddha


1813

he rolls thin snow
into a Buddha...
the child


1813

a sparrow chirping
in his lap...
snow Buddha


1813

growing old too
I trust in a Buddha
of snow


1813

ashamed--
even a child has made
a snow Buddha


1813

first snow--
making a Buddha of you
is hard too


1813

the snow Buddha
likes the puppy
it seems


1813

grow old
at my gate, if you wish...
snow Buddha


1813

naughty child--
instead of his chores
a snow Buddha


1813

my snowball--
the horse
ate it


1813

to the beat
of the snowballs
he tumbles


1813

hurled, it lands
in my sleeve...
a snowball


1813

until the big chrysanthemum's
completely gobbled...
my winter seclusion


1813

he's called
the mum-gobbling bug...
winter seclusion


1813

in Great Japan
women do it too...
winter seclusion


1813

are my neighbors...
winter seclusion


1813

left for the crows...

1813

line of sight...
a little thicket


1813

some little pest nibbles
my chrysanthemum


1813

come, sparrows!
get warm at my brazier
I'm a great hero!


1813

in my previous life
good seeds were sown...
my cozy brazier!


1813

on a clear morning
the coal fire in a crackling
mood


1813

more than enough
for Priest Issa...
one bag of coal


1813

morning's charcoal fire--
the mountain's pine breeze
wafting by


1813

whether upright
or crooked it's the same...

1813

for pounding charcoal

1813

1813

for one person
it's more than enough...
gathered charcoal


1813

one measure of charcoal too

1813

good luck god
come live here, please!
morning's charcoal fire


1813

where waves pound the shore..."
winter's first charcoal fire


1813

though crooked
it's quite a sight...
morning's charcoal fire


1813

even the dog won't come...
morning's charcoal fire


1813

1813

that made blossom clouds

doesn't feel

1813

the old man's charcoal kiln
is smoking


1813

even a woman slurps

spring's on its way

1813

1813

the mountain road's

1814

it's New Year's Day!

my life

this morning's sky

with a pale blue

1814

and its halo...
spring has come


1814

it's become a moonlit

1814

again


1814

it's tiny

1814

1814

nice

1814

a world

a flower even Buddha

the dragonfly, too
works late...
night fishing

my nights of pleasure

new summer robe

a nod...

because of love
they call him
"thieving cat!"

stuck to his nose...

1815

in tea blossoms
the nightingale's child's
singing lessons


1815

don't leave my hut!
singing plover

to pieces...
plovers!


1815

not an old voice
among them


1815

1815

where to now?


1815

they're Suma Beach's plovers!
plovers!

I know! pufferfish's
bloated face

red chrysanthemum!
another winter rain

even for me
there's a guardian god!
blossoming spring

1816

snow at the gate

in my do-nothing house

1816

long! in this vain
world today


1816

the long day

1816

this is my life--
cold mornings

1816

1816

the pony also
sets off on a journey...
autumn dusk


1816

parentless
I only have my shadow...

1816

another year
I didn't die...
autumn dusk


1816

next to the roof beam
shining bright...
harvest moon


1816

amazing--
in the house I was born
seeing this moon


1816

in harvest moonlight
keeping his cool...
scarecrow


1816

harvest moon--
on a stone a teacup
filled with sake


1816

in pampas grass shadows
drinking sake


1816

harvest moon
on the mountain scarecrow's
sleeve


1816

a wretched shame--
my heart
like the autumn sky


1816

like pebbles pounding
the eaves...
autumn rain


1816

in the autumn wind
clutching my sleeve...
little butterfly


1816

autumn wind--
a cock-a-doodling rooster
on the roof


1816

loafing--
even in the blossom capital
autumn wind


1816

every morning
enough for my tea kettle...
dew in the grass


1816

my ramshackle hut--
the dewdrops' great exertion
in vain


1816

from today on
to see is to pray...
dewdrops in the grass


1816

mountain mist
twining 'round my legs...
sunset


1816

moo, moo, moo
from the mist cows
emerge


1816

from the great bronze
Buddha's nostrils
mist escapes


1816

from the great bronze
Buddha's nose mist...
softly, softly


1816

fall quickly, hide
my home village...
mist and cold rain


1816

mountain mist
just passing through...
big sitting room


1816

clear evening--
lined up in the pale blue
autumn mountains


1816

even the mountain village's
pissing place...
a field of flowers


1816

bidding the tamed pony
farewell


1816

under a full moon
led away from his mother


1816

standing in a world
of tranquility...
the scarecrow

settles to sleep...
on the scarecrow


1816

dangles...
on the scarecrow


1816

accompanying
the cricket's song...
pounding cloth at night


1816

the cat that can't stand it
happy-go-lucky


1816

home village--
even in their sleep pounding
cloth


1816

don't cry, geese!
from now on
I'm a traveler too


1816

a pretty bird
passes in silence...
migrating


1816

again and again
my same companion...
migrating bird


1816

my crappy house too!
migrating birds


1816

insects, too, do their night work
while singing


1816

yet still singing...
autumn cicada


1816

his body's husk...
dragonfly


1816

moon at the gate


1816

holding fast
to the boulder...
a dragonfly


1816

at my gate
just a soot-colored
dragonfly


1816

the katydid
on my hut's post
gnawing away


1816

and my tinkling in the piss-pot

katydid

the katydid

1816

a katydid

my wrinkled foot


1816

down!
maiden flower


1816

that fawn--
how old is it?
blooming bush clover


1816

all clogged up...

1816

secluded house--
enough buckwheat blooms
for one


1816

my hut's rice field
somehow pulled it off...
harvest time


1816

this world today--
even pampas grass
is blown in stripes

the mushy
persimmon eaters

like old times

hollow gourd

1816

finished, so is
the conversation

for me, too, winter
begins


1816

through a hole in the wall
the cold

using his head
the high priest breaking
icicles


1816

but spring comes anyway...
who cares?!

the year ends

crushed under

my door


1817

my hut--
in the bamboo, a crow

in


1817

1817

the novice priest


1817

while singing a ditty
crossing the ice


1817

my house's
only face towel
frozen stiff


1817

from the tip
of the field Buddha's nose...
an icicle


1817

my house--
even the first icicle
soot-stained


1817

falling on only
three houses...
steady winter rain


1817

the stepchild's finger
in his mouth...
winter rain


1817

in winter wind
unladylike she crouches
astride the brazier


1817

winter wind--
wrapped in tree leaves
a salted fish


1817

winter wind--
in the eaves an insect cage
and dried persimmons


1817

the first snowfall
scratched to bits...
crows


1817

"First snowfall!"
this year the voice
is weaker


1817

first snow--
on the desktop
a snowball


1817

clinging fast
to my house's rear wall...
dirty snow


1817

just a smidgen of light
from the snow...
latrine alley


1817

bottoms up
the kettles drying
on the snow


1817

snowy day--
practicing writing
in the tray's ashes


1817

the child carries
her cloth monkey...
hailstones


1817

to the town's center
under a table he goes...
hailstones


1817

a child holds a winnow
over his head...
hailstones


1817

the first winter rain
didn't forget...
the twelfth day!


1817

olden times tug at the heart--
the Old Man's
wooden bowl


1817

my hut's soot--
a storm kindly
does the sweeping


1817

my hut's soot--
just blowing it
does the job


1817

my hut's soot--
going through the motions
of sweeping it


1817

sweeping the soot
washing the fence...
sickle moon


1817

play in this soot
I swept!
gate's sparrows


1817

chickens trampling
the rice cakes...
a comedy


1817

the sound of pounding--
millet dumpling
being made


1817

the fresh rice cake
goes flying...
the dog's mouth


1817

in this world
even my kneading makes
rice cakes!


1817

pigeons and sparrows
come! come!
I've got rice cakes


1817

Fukagawa--
on a boat, too, a party
drinks away the year


1817

from the bill collector
a ladel full
of water


1817

on the road
even a cat's futon
I borrow


1817

putting on snowshoes
going outside...
for no reason


1817

the servant displays
a holy image...
snow Buddha


1817

the puppy
chases after it...
snowball


1817

this year it doesn't reach
the nettle tree...
my snowball


1817

blocks with her butt...
snowball

1817

1817

wriggles in head-first...

1817

for the expert
at swatting flies...
winter seclusion


1817

a war lord
drenching wet, passes
my cozy brazier


1817

"It's good at first!"
her foot pushes
the foot-warmer


1817

how shameful--
with my charcoal-stained
palms...


1817

in careful bits
another thing of this floating world...
weighing charcoal


1817

the high priest also
takes a seat


1817

even breaking firewood
with my knee...
a feat


1817

though night is pitch black
the banked fire
works fine


1817

painted fan's prostitute
laugh at me too!
taking medicine


1817

why so restless
restless, restless?
little wren


1817

it's your big day
the 30th of Ninth Month!
wren


1817

a wren
on the dog's prowling route
creeps


1817

little wren
in falling rain drenched
to the bone


1817

here and there
in little meetings...
plovers


1817

going out to piss
for the hundredth time...
plovers in the night


1817

bright moon--
the plovers all buried
in the house's thatch


1817

what a huge convocation!
plovers
on the beach


1817

is the falling snow
medicine for your voices
plovers?


1817

with red leaves
on their heads, the waterfowl
asleep


1817

in the withering mix...
temple road


1817

even the grasses
that stab people
clumsily wither


1817

once upon a time there was
a she-demon...


1817

a battle royal
with radishes...
children


1817

in fallen leaves
the crow who respects
his parents


1817

burying the latrine
of the lover cat...
fallen leaves


1817

without you--
how vast
is the grove


1818

oh gods
this year again I pray...
two children, please?


1818

though it's First Month
twenty days
in my winter coat


1818

First Month--
even at the outcast's porch
plum blossoms


1818

First Month--
tonight a night
of plum blossom moon


1818

crawl and laugh--
from this morning on
a two year old!


1818

at my feet
a bird springs up
with the spring!


1818

new spring
Yataro dies, priest Issa
is born


1818

spring has sprung--
a one-day, two-day
sickle moon


1818

a peaceful spring
rolls in


1818

the wrinkles of my hands...
year's first day

the year's first day

1818

1818

it's a crooked path
to the New Year's shelf


1818

in the bamboo basket...
a sparrow!


1818

and the moon has deigned
to rise!

1818

even for me a square
of zoni


1818

though we say

1818

1818

here too everyone's

1818

1818

1818

the day is devilishly
long!
long!


1818

plum blossoms, where?
Second Month snow
two or three feet deep

among the sparrows

spring snow

even the spring snow

sings at six a.m.

don't die! until evenings
of fireflies


1818

the green willow's
friendliness rubs off
on my house


1818

ten games at once...
willow trees


1818

crappy hut, now...
a green willow!


1818

the willow
suggests


1818

here and there
a plain and to-the-point

1818

my willow tree--
not that good
at drooping


1818

peeks in the window...
summer heat


1818

hot day--
the cool abacus
for a pillow


1818

so hot! so hot!
sleeping
is a chore


1818

the white caterpillar
on the chestnut tree...
also is hot!


1818

Shinano road's mountains
bearing down...
the heat!


1818

in this grass, I've heard...
summer heat


1818

like Amida Buddha...
cross-legged


1818

like Gautama Buddha...
cross-legged

for this cloudburst...

1818

two or three cups, now

bare-chested with a little
sake cup

so cleverly...
swallows


1818

the floating cloud
pushes up peaks
with ease


1818

on my sleeping mat
counting with my feet...

even the clouds convene
at the temple


1818

how good
to see a pagoda!
billowing clouds


1818

big river--
pouring into my sake cup
the summer moon


1818

an excessively polite
red flower

wanting to lick

crying child

of children too...

even the moon

struts like a peacock...

Eighth Day...
red flowers


1818

the Buddha
even in beggar-town
is born


1818

1818

clings to it...

1818

even the cormorants
on holiday today...
festival


1818

the mother cormorant
cries at the gate

1818

with one hand...
summer kimono


1818

her mother says...
summer kimono


1818

how delightful--
my sweat-soaked
bathrobe!


1818

under my mosquito net...

1818

flits and flutters...

a chrysanthemum


1819

the thicket's chrysanthemum
blooms
in secret


1819

mountain temple--
among the provisions
chrysanthemums


1819

peacefully asleep
it has bloomed...
nameless chrysanthemum


1819

lazy, lazy! I water it
not even with dewdrops...
my chrysanthemum


1819

like me
getting plenty of sleep...
chrysanthemum


1819

rented to the blooming
morning-glories...
my eaves


1819

a school for praising
Buddha...
my hut's ivy


1819

dropping from
the young buck's mouth
bush clover blossoms


1819

the arrowroot vine
holds on tight...
a post


1819

the nondrinker's hut
is an eyesore...
blooming orchids


1819

the horse doesn't hardly
bend his neck...
heads of rice


1819

stretching its neck
the rice-loaded horse
passes


1819

the dragonfly too
folds hands in prayer...
rice blossoms


1819

never giving up
my field rustles too...
heads of rice


1819

evening moon--
on the harvested rice
a bottle of sake


1819

offering a prayer
to Amida Buddha...
pampas grass


1819

holding it
against her cheek...
the red persimmon


1819

an acorn strikes
the bell
of evil


1819

from the treetop
the monkey points out
the mushrooms


1819

for five or six people
only one...
mushroom hunting


1819

for the baby monkey
a nip of sake...
mushroom hunting


1819

a nip of sake...
mushroom hunting


1819

the mushroom hunters
return empty-handed...
fussing


1819

snowflakes flitting down--
a winter solstice
celebration


1819

for one penny
one hit on the prayer gong...
how cold it is!


1819

merely the sight
of wolf shit...
how cold it is!


1819

the old banner
flaps in a thicket
in the cold


1819

"A starling from the sticks!"
he taunts...
how cold it is


1819

evening's glow--
the deep, deep red
first ice


1819

at the tip of the pole
paper flapping...
a spring day in winter


1819

come what may
trusting in the Buddha
the year ends


1819

paying no heed
to the year's last day...
a floating bird, asleep


1819

evening mountain--
the color of buckwheat noodles
first winter rain

winter rain

circles the trap...
steady winter rain

is overrun...

rain


1819

my backyard

slippers

the playful pig

the dirty snow
holds on

isn't joking

my poor sake bottle
is dry

withered fields

yet she chants winter prayers
nonetheless

he seemed to be coming...
neighbor with rice cakes

back...

rice cakes are growing
on willow branches

drinking away the year

drinking away the year

drinking away the year

but gets his share...
lucky beans

lucky holly

a new year begins!
the color of barley

"Demons begone!"


1819

and this world's demons
should flee

even the children

a year older

rises at once

the same withering

don't want to, still...
there's my house!


1819

there's my house!

this corrupt world's sky

this year's bamboo

those have turned pale blue...

the dog's toilet...

1821

they fall and scatter...
cherry blossoms


1821

shading his eyes to gaze...
a weasel


1821

Kyoto pilgrimage


1821

today, all day
the playful clouds


1821

cool breeze--
through the window
Pure Land Paradise!


1821

one tatami mat spreads
in my house


1821

ladling coins
with a spoon


1821

evening cool--
my umbrella-hat left
at the last inn


1821

behind me too...
a blind woman from Echigo


1821

feeling like silver
or goldfish


1821

no incense
no farts

this frog is making!

with a pigeon...

1821

how many cloudbursts?
the mountain in back


1821

get a cloudburst

god of the mountain


1821

hate it...

retraces its steps...

1821

a blind man

1821

just to kill time

1821

though small
they line up too...
peaks of clouds


1821

and above, too

1821

it's your turn to dry up...

1821

in today's world
they're "old man beaters"...

even the stone Buddha

1821

the umbrella-hat gathered...
by the person behind


1821

"a chestnut hit
an old man..."
a story told for ages


1821

fool cat--
eyes returning to where
the chestnut was


1821

the pitter-patter
of falling chestnuts...
a rainy night


1821

of the wolf...
mouse mushroom

the entrance
to a haunted place

the laughing child


1821

my child

to the Pure Land...
life's cold winter

1821

now being careful...
ice


1821

no storehouse was ever
built by a non-drinker...
the year ends


1821

no farts...
the year ends


1821

1821

again


1821

1821

1821

suddenly
a storm


1821

winter storms


1821

accepts it...

1821

1821

well at least it's a nice

1821

1821

1821

does the cactus
grasp the great truth?
morning frost


1821

such a night

1821

the ring-ringing in my ears

1821

with the gods all gone

1821

have no objection

1822

the well's bottom, too

1822

1822

croaking


1822

a popular song--
from the bottom of the well

1822

1822

a traveler
walking along, airing

evening cool--
the great high priest

1822

in today's world

1822

1822

even worthless me

you've found?

at last...

1824

from the cut branch
a leafy strand...
willow tree

at my gate

1824

straight from the holy grove
it comes

1825

with a cloudburst
kneaded in completely...
the field


1825

a rainstorm--
Kisa Lagoon's farmland
and Kanman Temple


1825

in the cloudburst
chin up, back straight...
chrysanthemum


1825

rainstorm--
a naked rider
on a naked horse


1825

rainstorm--
the shrine in the thicket's
twelve lamps


1825

the Buddha--
on his birthday a shower
of coins


1825

Buddha pretends
to be born...
bells and big drums


1825

the Buddha
immersed in coins celebrates
his birthday


1825

summer seclusion--
every night the toad
comes calling


1825

others might think
I'm at my summer calligraphy...
little window


1825

about ten times through
for the foundling...
purification hoop


1825

on the little plague god
floating away...
lice


1825

"Farewell! Farewell!"
the plague god floats away...
little child


1825

night fishing--
the ones that get away
all runts


1825

at long last
the cloudburst!
the big drum booms


1825

in straw raincoats
for the summer shower...
drinking party


1825

the swallow
wide-mouthed chatters...
new summer robes


1825

how delightful--
my damp, sweaty
traveler's bathrobe


1825

the pony's eyes
look afraid...
parasols


1825

in wooden clogs
crossing a narrow rope...
with parasol


1825

a beggar goes first
praising Buddha...
with parasol


1825

white umbrella-hats
pale blue parasols...
Higashi Mountains


1825

on the cooked rice-tub
the bamboo blind is green...
trashy house


1825

Ryogaku Bridge--
a little boat with green
bamboo blinds


1825

in evening's mosquito net
rustling
wildflowers


1825

on the fan's handle
the baby sucks...
a substitute


1825

wind-making goblin
where are you fanning
your fan?


1825

the child on her back
cries to the beat...
rice-planting song


1825

even a little child
comes out of the house...
rice planters' lunch


1825

the wisteria too
blooming en masse...
rice-planting song


1825

making a waterfall
under the eaves...
sweet jelly


1825

a bat flits
under my sleeve...
moonlit night


1825

generations of bats
have called this storehouse
home


1825

bats keep the pilgrims
company...
Buddha of Healing


1825

flood waters--
bats dangle
from the crossing-rope


1825

I entrust my home
for the night
to mosquito-eating bats


1825

great Edo
from nook to nook
"cuckoo!"


1825

a big leap--
the fleeing burglar
and a cuckoo


1825

waking the farmer
from his siesta...
cuckoo


1825

while the canoe goes
swish, swish, swish...
a cuckoo


1825

the goblins are gone
so get to work!
cuckoo


1825

having a jumping contest
a night burglar
a cuckoo


1825

just one song
then turning a cold shoulder...
cuckoo


1825

a cuckoo sings
the little boat goes
swish, swish!


1825

turning a cold shoulder
to the one who waited...
cuckoo


1825

pecking rice
on the shrine's fence...
mountain cuckoo


1825

the village hits
a crescendo of snores...
reed thrush


1825

"The dog took your lunch!"
the reed thrush
tattles


1825

working at night
under the full moon...
reed thrush


1825

night work singing
under the full moon...
reed thrush


1825

no wife and kids
waiting for you?
lingering duck


1825

the world today!
even a snake's skin
for sale


1825

sleeping in the house
it bumped into...
big firefly


1825

escaping the fight outside
my hut's
fireflies


1825

one more
cross the river!
fireflies flit


1825

after the bath
tickling my armpit...
firefly


1825

eat and run, the wisdom
of mosquitoes and fleas...
Wisdom Buddha's temple


1825

on the high priest's
head...
flies making love


1825

the bell of life passing--
O flies and worms
listen well!


1825

since I'm decrepit
the fleas aren't worried
about escaping


1825

since I'm old
the fleas aren't worried
about escaping


1825

burning fleas
to predict the weather...
mountain home


1825

good moon--
but going inside
a hell of fleas


1825

Tone River--
only one solitary
water strider


1825

cicadas chirr--
the blind priest's fan
his umbrella-hat


1825

so teeny-tiny
resting in peace
little snail


1825

bamboo leaf--
he takes his little portion
the snail


1825

great Edo--
even for the dog
summer's first bonito


1825

a whole bonito fish
for the shotgun house
an uproar!


1825

to my humble hut
they come to gawk...
summer's first bonito


1825

carrying a poppy
he passes through
the quarrel


1825

a money-making
temple...
the peonies in bloom


1825

the temple favors
the Chinese style...
with its peonies


1825

stuck in a hole
in a stone signpost...
a peony


1825

a masterly climb
to the top of the peony...
frog


1825

the swallow wipes
his muddy mouth...
on the peony


1825

day after day
bathing in wheat chaff...
the peony


1825

rice chaff--
the path through
the peony garden


1825

mountain clouds--
that red one is a field
of peonies!


1825

barley husking--
in the middle of a highway
a tea kettle


1825

barley husking--
a paper lantern
in the gate's nettle tree


1825

thatched roof--
how many ears of barley
did birds bring?


1825

thatched roof--
the bird has added
an ear of barley


1825

children hiccup
in the shade...
fresh green leaves


1825

a noble effort--
the scraggly hedge too
has fresh green leaves


1825

hearing voices
the leech drops...
summer trees


1825

back window--
just one tree
for deep tree shade


1825

a flower big
as an umbrella-hat...
deep tree shade


1825

the Shinto priest's
festival for one...
deep tree shade


1825

wildflowers blooming
pure white...
deep tree shade


1825

deutzia blossom hedge
the dog's
maternity room


1825

deutzia blossoms--
the children visit
the frog's grave


1825

a sight to see!
from a hole in the wall
autumn moon


1825

hole in the old wall
a famous resort...
autumn moon


1825

through the wall's hole
the harvest moon...
sleep time's pleasure


1825

harvest moon
through the wall's hole...
a late riser


1825

"Praise! Praise!"
in harvest moonlight
a child prays


1825

one harvest moon
special-delivered...
little room


1825

starvation gives way
to rice cakes!
Ninth Month moon


1825

autumn wind--
Issa's heart and mind
stirring


1825

autumn wind--
it's from the Buddha's
Western Paradise!


1825

my home village
can't see it now...
autumn wind


1825

eating my rice
in solitude...
autumn wind


1825

a bell is clanging
nonstop...
autumn wind


1825

incense smoke
on the Buddha in the field...
morning dew


1825

on the straw sandals
of a visitor...
the gate's dewdrops


1825

lightning flash--
lying in a row, faces
of sixty year-olds


1825

the evening teahouse
by the river is closing...
little lightning


1825

on leaves of bamboo
lightning
flickers, flickers


1825

at my house
morning mist, noon mist
evening mist


1825

the darling child
summons his mother
crawling, laughing


1825

the ancestors come
and inspect it...
rice field by the gate


1825

child in my arms--
"Mama's coming!"
he hits the prayer gong


1825

on the ancestors' altar
flopping down to sleep...
thieving cat


1825

an orphan led
by hand...
a lantern for the grave


1825

that dancer's voice--
just like mother's
like mother's!


1825

cool night--
which stars are the children?
the great-great-grandchildren?


1825

beaming smiles
in the best of moods...
two stars


1825

from time immemorial
Bride Star!
Groom Star!


1825

even one-penny
fireworks...
ooo! ahh!


1825

even for me--
fabulously expensive
fireworks!


1825

stooping
to enter his house...
sumo wrestler


1825

the sumo wrestler
apologizing, releases
the sparrow


1825

the wrestler's defeat
spreads a thousand miles
quickly


1825

temple mountain--
the dog also barks
at a scarecrow


1825

nagging, nagging--
the new sake
is drained


1825

the young buck kneels
on one knee...
moon gazing


1825

the sacred deer
stand still
to be petted


1825

on a large beach
early risers for breakfast...
snipe


1825

geese at my gate--
when I return
how they glare!


1825

wild geese clamoring
and one pretentious
crow


1825

geese and ducks
honking, quacking away...
the horse


1825

making themselves at home
asleep, awake...
geese at my gate


1825

even the stag beetle
calls for a wife...
night voices


1825

grassy meadow--
insects crowd 'round
the paper lantern


1825

he's utterly given up
silent
insect


1825

grumbling--
the insects outside
the house in the trees


1825

don't sing, insects!
the world will get better
in its own time


1825

though a weak insect
he holds his own...
that voice!


1825

against the black fence
trying to hide...
dragonfly


1825

the dragonfly's
steady glare...
Mount Fuji


1825

a cricket
tickling my face
passes by


1825

trampled to pieces
by the crickets...
my eaves


1825

in the dried river
swimming splendidly...
locust


1825

in the flood
trusting divine protection...
locust


1825

in the flood
its karma is strong...
flying locust


1825

even at the peak
of my hut's grass roof...
a locust


1825

the leftovers
caught by the cat, people eat...
locusts


1825

biting the hand
that sets it free...
katydid


1825

village child--
accompanies the earthworms' song
with flute


1825

that voice
he's a young one...
earthworm


1825

the earthworms' song
grows thinner...
night by night


1825

the ocean--
coming for sardines
even the dog


1825

the farm field's layout--
here and there
chrysanthemums


1825

perfectly straight
if we let it be...
chrysanthemum


1825

about as good
as the morning-glories...
temple bell


1825

morning-glory--
a poor vine accompanies it
creeping along


1825

dawn--
the windblown, exhausted
maiden flowers


1825

maiden flowers--
after one windy night
fallen


1825

an unexpected
country teahouse...
blooming bush clover


1825

the young buck
with a load on his back...
red leaves


1825

into the sunken hearth
they're swept...
red leaves


1825

mountain temple--
all the buildings strewn
with red leaves


1825

the paulownia leaf
his fly-guard...
he sleeps


1825

the old priest
fans himself...
paulownia leaf


1825

heading for where
quince is scarce...
rose of Sharon


1825

crumbled house--
the glorious roses
of Sharon


1825

this side trimmed
that side resentful...
hedge of roses


1825

the crows join
the children...
gathering chestnuts


1825

makes no difference to me--
the year ends
or doesn't end


1825

so pretty--
as the year finally ends
evening's sky


1825

two winter storms
come one after the other...
field by the gate


1825

"First snowfall!"
they rise and sing...
worms in my gut


1825

a teeny-tiny bit--
even Heaven's snow
in short supply


1825

pissing
with the neighbor...
evening snow


1825

on a half-snow
half-mud road...
slogging along


1825

on a snowy day
the temple is packed...
pigeons, sparrows


1825

the hut's dog is escort
to the winter
prayers


1825

"It's Basho's Death-Day!"
he says
to himself


1825

walking into sunset
on Basho's Death-Day...
straw sandals


1825

Basho's Death-Day--
from noon on, open house
at the hut


1825

sneezing I take
another sake break...
sweeping soot


1825

in a package from Edo
new clothes...and I'm not
his dad!


1825

beautiful courtesan--
new clothes for her hometown's
Buddha


1825

the dog
braces himself...
snowball!


1825

the do-gooder reluctantly
begins...
his winter seclusion


1825

pufferfish soup--
all the houses
snoring together


1825

house of reeds
where plovers sleep
plastered with crap


1825

beach plovers
raise a ruckus...
the dog runs away


1825

entering Kyoto too
a bunch of sour-faced
pufferfish!


1825

with a radish
driving off a deer...
his field


1825

the little imp
totes one too...
radishes


1825

so that the nightingale
can make a living
fallen leaves


1825

frost-killed grass--
the poor town stretches
foolishly long


1825

Musashi Plain--
in its standing water
Mount Fuji


1826

spring breeze--
across the field a parade
of light blue parasols


1826

timing his death
extremely well...
the Buddha


1826

observing well
this world of blossoms...
Buddha dies


1826

a nightingale sings--
the empty palace
his field


1826

the baby swallow's
flying lesson...
off the horse's rump


1826

taming the flesh
he moves through thorns...
a frog


1826

hot tub steam
wafts softly, softly...
as does a butterfly


1826

some of them stick
to people, young grasses
at their peak


1826

cherry blossom shade--
no sleeping for me
feeling afraid


1826

the world today!
umbrella-hatted princes and paupers
blossom viewing


1826

imitating
the menacing dog...
blossom viewing


1826

mountain temple--
below where I sprawl
clouds of blossoms


1826

the price of grain
falls bitterly...
the heat


1826

garden at the gate--
a tailor-made
little cloudburst


1826

through a hole
you can see the lake...
billowing clouds


1826

making mountains rise
in the clouds...
cawing crow


1826

burning trash
in a field...
billowing clouds


1826

less high
than the sins of men...
peak of a cloud


1826

lacking the good sense
to form billows...
rushing clouds


1826

cleaning the well--
on a stone a bottle
of sacred sake


1826

even cool air basking
not worth the bother...
moon at the gate


1826

safe and sound
in the healing hot spring
my arm's flea


1826

let's go then
into the autumn evening
for our farewells


1826

in my sake cup
down the hatch!
the Milky Way


1826

old wall--
from whichever hole
autumn moon


1826

for the children
rice cakes while they gaze...
almost harvest moon


1826

secluded house--
in the mood tonight
to moon-gaze


1826

harvest moon--
even crabs claim
the name "Taira!"


1826

pretending to watch
the harvest moon...
rice field-gazing


1826

a world-healing
night of the 15th...
moon gazing


1826

river by the gate--
thrown in a corner
the Ninth month moon


1826

dewdrops forming--
when might I become
grass...or a tree?


1826

by Bon lantern light
eating my rice...
naked


1826

Tanabata Night--
the well-behaved children
of beggar-town


1826

looks like he's composing
a "Star Poem"...
the frog


1826

remote village--
among the grave lanterns
a katydid


1826

the puppy walks by
with a hat...
fallen leaf


1826

snow flitting down--
the mountains of Shinano
aren't joking


1826

my beloved cherry tree
cooked too...
making charcoal


1827

New Year's Day--
all of us in a corrupt world's
blossoms


1827

even the cart man
wears a courtier's hat...
plum blossoms


1827

flowing water spells
the character "heart"...
plum blossoms


1827

at the dinner
tray's edge...
a green rice field


1827

he circles his rice field
an open fan tucked
behind


1827

stuttering about
the olden days...
a cuckoo


1827

behind the morning-glories
a hell
of fleas


1827

let it be
let it be! the flea
has children


1827

sweeping fleas
onto the highway...
moonlit night


1827

world of man--
in a little stone field
catching fleas


1827

world of man--
even walking on sand
picking up fleas


1827

on burnt ground
the fleas throw a wild
party


1827

after the fire--
the fleas throw a wild
party


1827

moon in the autumn dawn--
nearing month's end
lantern in the eaves


1827

my home village
at the end of that cloud...
autumn dusk


1827

at the shrine
children sumo wrestlers...
autumn wind


1827

pipe smoke blowing
it tastes like tobacco...
autumn wind


1827

on green reeds
in a row...
Bon Festival Buddhas


1827

bonfires for the dead--
soon they'll burn
for us


1827

dawn of the month's
last day...
for Bon lanterns in the eaves


1827

one dies out
two die out...
lanterns for the dead


1827

after Tanabata Night's
coolness
a hot tub soak


1827

the pony stepping
and crunching...
chestnuts in the field


1827

knocking chestnuts
out of the little garden...
thief cat!


1827

he's also in no mood
to sweep the snow...
scarecrow


1827

even to the approaching dog
"Who's there?"
winter quilt
